other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is mildly distended with circumferential wall edema, multiple calcified internal stones, and trace pericholecystic fluid. Liver is normal in echogenicity, without focal lesions. Normal hepatopetal flow in the portal vein. No intrahepatic biliary dilation. Common bile duct is top normal for age at 8 mm. Spleen measures 10.8 cm. Pancreas is not visualized, due to shadowing bowel gas.
